Current Data

Historical Data Cleaning

import pandas as pd 
import seaborn as sns 

historic_data = pd.read_csv("../../../data/NABR_historic.csv")

historic_data.columns

data_colmap = {
    "long" : "longitude",
    "lat" : "latitude",
    "TimePeriod" : "time_period",
    "RCP" : "rep_con_path",
    "treecanopy" : "pct_treecanopy", 
    "Ann_Herb" : "pct_annual_herbcov",
    "Bare" : "pct_bareground",
    "Herb" : "pct_herbcov",
    "Litter" : "pct_plantlittercov",
    "Shrub" : "pct_shrubcov",
    "DrySoilDays_Summer_whole" : "drysoildays_summer",
    "Evap_Summer" : "evap_summer", 
    "ExtremeShortTermDryStress_Summer_whole" : "xtr_st_drysoilstress_summer", 
    "FrostDays_Winter" : "frostdays_winter", 
    "NonDrySWA_Summer_whole" : "nondry_swa_summer",
    "PPT_Winter" : "precipitation_winter", 
    "PPT_Summer" : "precipitation_summer",
    "PPT_Annual" : "precipitation_annual", 
    "T_Winter" : "temp_winter",
    "T_Summer" : "temp_summer", 
    "T_Annual" : "temp_annual", 
    "Tmax_Summer" : "maxtemp_summer", 
    "Tmin_Winter" : "mintemp_winter", 
    "VWC_Winter_whole" : "volwater_winter", 
    "VWC_Spring_whole" : "volwater_spring", 
    "VWC_Summer_whole" : "volwater_summer", 
    "VWC_Fall_whole" : "volwater_fall"
}

historic_data = historic_data.rename(columns=data_colmap)
historic_data.columns
import plotly.express as px
import plotly 

temp_subset_cols = ["longitude", "latitude", "year", "frostdays_winter", 'temp_winter',
       'temp_summer', 'temp_annual', 'maxtemp_summer', 'mintemp_winter']
temp_subset_hist = historic_data[temp_subset_cols]
temp_subset_hist.head(10)
fdw = ["year", "frostdays_winter", "longitude", "latitude"]
fdw = historic_data[fdw]
fdw = fdw.dropna().drop_duplicates()
fdw_agg = fdw.groupby("year")["frostdays_winter"].agg("mean").reset_index()


tw = ["year", "temp_winter", "longitude", "latitude"]
tw = historic_data[tw]
tw = tw.dropna().drop_duplicates()
tw_agg = tw.groupby("year")["temp_winter"].agg("mean").reset_index()


ts = ["year", "temp_summer", "longitude", "latitude"]
ts = historic_data[ts]
ts = ts.dropna().drop_duplicates()
ts_agg = ts.groupby("year")["temp_summer"].agg("mean").reset_index()


ta = ["year", "temp_annual", "longitude", "latitude"]
ta = historic_data[ta]
ta = ta.dropna().drop_duplicates()
ta_agg = ta.groupby("year")["temp_annual"].agg("mean").reset_index()

mts = ["year", "maxtemp_summer", "longitude", "latitude"]
mts = historic_data[mts]
mts = mts.dropna().drop_duplicates()
mts_agg = mts.groupby("year")["maxtemp_summer"].agg("mean").reset_index()


mtw = ["year", "mintemp_winter", "longitude", "latitude"]
mtw = historic_data[mtw]
mtw = mtw.dropna().drop_duplicates()
mtw_agg = mtw.groupby("year")["mintemp_winter"].agg("mean").reset_index()
cleaned_hist_subset = pd.merge(fdw_agg, tw_agg, on = "year", how = "outer")
cleaned_hist_subset = pd.merge(cleaned_hist_subset, ts_agg, on = "year", how = "outer")
cleaned_hist_subset = pd.merge(cleaned_hist_subset, ta_agg, on = "year", how = "outer")
cleaned_hist_subset = pd.merge(cleaned_hist_subset, mts_agg, on = "year", how = "outer")
cleaned_hist_subset = pd.merge(cleaned_hist_subset, mtw_agg, on = "year", how = "outer")
cleaned_hist_subset = cleaned_hist_subset.drop_duplicates()
cleaned_hist_subset
cleaned_hist_subset.columns

Historical Data Line Graph

px.line(cleaned_hist_subset, x = "year", y = ['frostdays_winter', 'temp_winter', 'temp_summer', 'temp_annual',
       'maxtemp_summer', 'mintemp_winter'])

Recent Data Cleaning

recent_data = pd.read_csv("../../../data/nearterm_data_2020-2024.csv")
recent_data = recent_data.rename(columns=data_colmap)
recent_data.head()
temp_subset_cols = ["year", "frostdays_winter", 'temp_winter',
       'temp_summer', 'temp_annual', 'maxtemp_summer', 'mintemp_winter']
temp_subset_recent = recent_data[temp_subset_cols]
temp_subset_recent.head(10)
fdw = ["year", "frostdays_winter", "longitude", "latitude"]
fdw = recent_data[fdw]
fdw = fdw.dropna().drop_duplicates()
fdw_agg = fdw.groupby("year")["frostdays_winter"].agg("mean").reset_index()


tw = ["year", "temp_winter", "longitude", "latitude"]
tw = recent_data[tw]
tw = tw.dropna().drop_duplicates()
tw_agg = tw.groupby("year")["temp_winter"].agg("mean").reset_index()


ts = ["year", "temp_summer", "longitude", "latitude"]
ts = recent_data[ts]
ts = ts.dropna().drop_duplicates()
ts_agg = ts.groupby("year")["temp_summer"].agg("mean").reset_index()


ta = ["year", "temp_annual", "longitude", "latitude"]
ta = recent_data[ta]
ta = ta.dropna().drop_duplicates()
ta_agg = ta.groupby("year")["temp_annual"].agg("mean").reset_index()

mts = ["year", "maxtemp_summer", "longitude", "latitude"]
mts = recent_data[mts]
mts = mts.dropna().drop_duplicates()
mts_agg = mts.groupby("year")["maxtemp_summer"].agg("mean").reset_index()


mtw = ["year", "mintemp_winter", "longitude", "latitude"]
mtw = recent_data[mtw]
mtw = mtw.dropna().drop_duplicates()
mtw_agg = mtw.groupby("year")["mintemp_winter"].agg("mean").reset_index()
cleaned_recent_subset = pd.merge(fdw_agg, tw_agg, on = "year", how = "outer")
cleaned_recent_subset = pd.merge(cleaned_recent_subset, ts_agg, on = "year", how = "outer")
cleaned_recent_subset = pd.merge(cleaned_recent_subset, ta_agg, on = "year", how = "outer")
cleaned_recent_subset = pd.merge(cleaned_recent_subset, mts_agg, on = "year", how = "outer")
cleaned_recent_subset = pd.merge(cleaned_recent_subset, mtw_agg, on = "year", how = "outer")
cleaned_recent_subset = cleaned_recent_subset.drop_duplicates()
cleaned_recent_subset
cleaned_recent_subset.columns

Merging Data Sets

cleaned_temp_subset = pd.merge(cleaned_hist_subset, cleaned_recent_subset, on = ['year', 'frostdays_winter', 'temp_winter', 'temp_summer', 'temp_annual',
       'maxtemp_summer', 'mintemp_winter'], how = "outer")
cleaned_temp_subset
cleaned_temp_subset.to_csv("../../../data/cleaned_temp_subset.csv")

data = d3.csv(../../../data/cleaned_temp_subset.csv)

Merged Line Graph

px.line(cleaned_temp_subset, x = "year", y = ['frostdays_winter', 'temp_winter', 'temp_summer', 'temp_annual',
       'maxtemp_summer', 'mintemp_winter'])

Dash App

import dash
from dash import dcc, html
from dash.dependencies import Input, Output
import pandas as pd
import dash_bootstrap_components as dbc
import plotly.express as px

app = dash.Dash(__name__, external_stylesheets=[dbc.themes.BOOTSTRAP])

# Load the data
cleaned_temp_subset = pd.read_csv("../../../data/cleaned_temp_subset.csv")

# Extract unique years for the dropdown options
years = [{'label': str(year), 'value': year} for year in cleaned_temp_subset["year"].unique()]

# Define the layout of the app
app.layout = html.Div([

    html.H1("Temperature Data", style={"text-align": "center"}),

    dcc.Dropdown(id="select_year", 
                 options=years,
                 multi=True, 
                 value=[1980], 
                 style={"width": "40%"}), 

    html.Div(id="output_container", children=[]), 
    html.Br(), 

    dcc.Graph(id="temp_map", figure={})
])

@app.callback(
    Output(component_id='output_container', component_property='children'),
    Output(component_id='temp_map', component_property='figure'),
    Input(component_id='select_year', component_property='value')
)
def update_graph(selected_years):
    # Filter data based on selected years
    filtered_df = cleaned_temp_subset[cleaned_temp_subset["year"].isin(selected_years)]

    # Transform the data to long format for Plotly Express
    long_df = filtered_df.melt(id_vars=["year"], 
                               value_vars=['temp_winter', 'temp_summer', 'temp_annual', 'maxtemp_summer', 'mintemp_winter'],
                               var_name="Metric", 
                               value_name="Value")

    # Create a bar plot using Plotly Express
    fig = px.bar(long_df, x="year", y="Value", color="Metric",
                 title="Temperature Data for Selected Years",
                 labels={'Value': 'Average Temperature (ºC)', 'Metric': 'Metrics'},
                 barmode='group')

    # Output message
    container = f"The year(s) selected by user: {', '.join(map(str, selected_years))}"

    return container, fig

if __name__ == "__main__":
    app.run_server(port=8051)
